template.template: Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP
template.name: Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP
template.description:
Monitors all parameters of Teltonika RUT9xx LTE routers
Version 1.1 2021-08-04 by Pierre Fagrell: Added missing macros and value mappings for network interface discovery - required for traffic usage stats
pierre@buggfix.se

trigger.expression: max(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/icmpping,#3)=0
trigger.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

trigger.expression: min(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100
trigger.name: High ICMP ping loss

dependency.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
dependency.expression: max(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/icmpping,#3)=0

dependency.name: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: min(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100

dependency.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
dependency.expression: max(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/icmpping,#3)=0

item.name: CPU utilization
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The average, over the last minute, of the percentage of time that processors was not idle. Implementations may approximate this one minute smoothing period if necessary.

trigger.expression: min(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/system.cpu.util,5m)>{$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}
trigger.name: High CPU utilization (over {$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}% for 5m)
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

trigger.expression: change(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/TELTONIKA-MIB.fwVersion)<>0
trigger.name: Firmware version changed to: {/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMPv2/TELTONIKA-MIB.fwVersion}

item.name: modemNum
item.description: The number of modems (regardless of their current state) present on this system.

item.name: SNMP Bad Community Names
item.description: The total number of community-based SNMP messages (for example, SNMPv1) delivered to the SNMP entity which used an SNMP community name not known to said entity.

trigger.expression: change(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/TELTONIKA-MIB.snmpBadCommunity)>0
trigger.name: SNMP Bad Community Names increased
trigger.description: This should never increase with proper firewall rules

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits received
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits sent
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to`n+499,999'. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed - If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2) - If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic - It should change todormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection) - It should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state - It should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing(typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototype.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2 or {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=0
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Total daily traffic
item_prototype.description: Total traffic sent and received today. Resets to 0 at midnight each day. x bits/s / 8 = x bytes/s x bytes/s * 60 = x bytes/min x bytes/min * 6 = x bytes since last update 60*6/8=45

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.total[daily.{#SNMPINDEX}])>{$IF.UTIL.DAILY}
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High daily traffic usage (>{$IF.UTIL.DAILY:"{#IFNAME}"} )

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits sent+received
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received and sent on the interface. Will be 0 if host offline or rebooted to prevent "not supported" on calculation in total traffic.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Total monthly traffic
item_prototype.description: Total traffic sent and received this month. Resets to 0 the first day every month.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.total[monthly.{#SNMPINDEX}])>{$IF.UTIL.MONTHLY}
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High monthly traffic usage (>{$IF.UTIL.MONTHLY:"{#IFNAME}"} )

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Total weekly traffic
item_prototype.description: Total traffic sent and received this week. Resets to 0 every Monday.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.total[weekly.{#SNMPINDEX}])>{$IF.UTIL.WEEKLY}
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High weekly traffic usage (>{$IF.UTIL.WEEKLY:"{#IFNAME}"} )

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Interface type
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The type of interface. Additional values for ifType are assigned by the Internet Assigned NumbersAuthority (IANA), through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

trigger_prototype.expression: change(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])<0 and last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and ( last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=6 or last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=7 or last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=11 or last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=62 or last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=69 or last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=117 ) and (last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (change(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2)>0) or (last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
dependency.recovery_expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2 or {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=0

trigger_prototype.expression: (avg(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}]) or avg(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])) and last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: avg(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}]) and avg(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage (>{$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
dependency.recovery_expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2 or {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=0

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or min(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: max(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8 and max(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate (>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
dependency.recovery_expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2 or {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=0

item.host: Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP

discovery_rule.name: hsSessionEntry Discovery
discovery_rule.description: An entry containing information of a particular hotspot session.

item_prototype.name: hssDwBandwidth for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Max download bandwidth in b/s. Cannot be accessed using SNMPv1.

item_prototype.name: hssDwLimit for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Download limit in bytes. Cannot be accessed using SNMPv1.

item_prototype.name: hssIdleTimeout for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Idle timeout in sec.

item_prototype.name: hssID for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Session ID

item_prototype.name: hssIndex for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each session.

item_prototype.name: hssIP for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Clients IP address

item_prototype.name: hssMAC for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Clients MAC address

item_prototype.name: hssState for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Session state

item_prototype.name: hssTimeLimit for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Time limit in sec. Cannot be accessed using SNMPv1.

item_prototype.name: hssUpBandwidth for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Max upwnload bandwidth in b/s. Cannot be accessed using SNMPv1.

item_prototype.name: hssUpLimit for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Upload limit in bytes. Cannot be accessed using SNMPv1.

item_prototype.name: hssURL for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Original URL

item_prototype.name: hssUsername for {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Username

discovery_rule.name: modemEntry Discovery
discovery_rule.description: An entry containing information of a particular interface.

item_prototype.name: mdCellID for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: CELL ID

item_prototype.name: mdConnectionState for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Sata session connection state

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/mConnectionState[{#SNMPVALUE}])<>"Connected"
trigger_prototype.name: Modem not Connected

item_prototype.name: mdConnectionType for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Data session connection type

item_prototype.name: mdDescr for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: A textual string containing information about the modem.

item_prototype.name: mdIMEI for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Modem IMEI

item_prototype.name: mdIMSI for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: IMSI for simcard

trigger_prototype.expression: change(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/mIMSI[{#SNMPVALUE}])=1
trigger_prototype.name: IMSI changed

item_prototype.name: mdIndex for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each modem.

item_prototype.name: mdManufacturer for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Modem manufacturer

item_prototype.name: mdModel for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Modem model

item_prototype.name: mdNetState for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Mobile network registration status

item_prototype.name: mdOperatorNumber for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Operator number (MCC+MNC)

item_prototype.name: mdOperator for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Operator currently in use

trigger_prototype.expression: change(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/mOperator[{#SNMPVALUE}])=1
trigger_prototype.name: Mobile operator changed

item_prototype.name: mdPinState for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: PIN status

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/mPinState[{#SNMPVALUE}])<>"READY"
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/mPinState[{#SNMPVALUE}])="READY"
trigger_prototype.name: Simcard PIN not READY

item_prototype.name: mdRevision for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Modem revision

item_prototype.name: mdRSRP for {#SNMPVALUE} operator {#OPERATOR} cellID {#MCELLID}
item_prototype.description: (4G only) Reference Signal Receive Power is the average power of Resource Elements (RE) that carry cell specific Reference Signals (RS) over the entire bandwidth. RSRP does a better job of measuring signal power from a specific sector while potentially excluding noise and interference from other sectors. -44 to -80 Excellent. -81 to -109 Good. -110 to -120 Slow <-121 Unusable

item_prototype.name: mdRSRP for {#SNMPVALUE} operator {#OPERATOR}
item_prototype.description: (4G only) Reference Signal Receive Power is the average power of Resource Elements (RE) that carry cell specific Reference Signals (RS) over the entire bandwidth. RSRP does a better job of measuring signal power from a specific sector while potentially excluding noise and interference from other sectors. -44 to -80 Excellent. -81 to -109 Good. -110 to -120 Slow <-121 Unusable

item_prototype.name: mdRSRP for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: (4G only) Reference Signal Receive Power is the average power of Resource Elements (RE) that carry cell specific Reference Signals (RS) over the entire bandwidth. RSRP does a better job of measuring signal power from a specific sector while potentially excluding noise and interference from other sectors. -44 to -80 Excellent. -81 to -109 Good. -110 to -120 Slow <-121 Unusable

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/mRSRP[{#SNMPVALUE}])<-109
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/mRSRP[{#SNMPVALUE}])>-110
trigger_prototype.name: Low Signal RSRP

item_prototype.name: mdRSRQ for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: (4G only) Quality considering also RSSI and the number of used Resource Blocks (N). RSRQ = (N * RSRP) / RSSI measured over the same bandwidth. RSRQ is a C/I type of measurement and it indicates the quality of the received reference signal. The RSRQ measurement provides additional information when RSRP is not sufficient to make a reliable handover or cell reselection decision. -3 to -10 Excellent. -11 to -15 Good. -16 to -19 Slow. –<-19.5 Unusable

item_prototype.name: mdSerial for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Serial number

item_prototype.name: mdRSSI for {#SNMPVALUE} operator {#OPERATOR} cellID {#MCELLID}
item_prototype.description:
> -65 Excellent. -64 to -75 Good. -76 to -85 Decent, may disconnect. -86 to -100 Slow with frequent disconnects.-101 to -125 Unusable.
The average total received power observed only in OFDM symbols containing reference symbols for antenna port 0 (i.e., OFDM symbol 0 & 4 in a slot) in the measurement bandwidth over N resource blocks. The total received power of the carrier RSSI includes the power from co-channel serving & non-serving cells, adjacent channel interference, thermal noise, etc. Total measured over 12-subcarriers including RS from Serving Cell, Traffic in the Serving Cell

item_prototype.name: mdRSSI for {#SNMPVALUE} operator {#OPERATOR}
item_prototype.description:
> -65 Excellent. -64 to -75 Good. -76 to -85 Decent, may disconnect. -86 to -100 Slow with frequent disconnects.-101 to -125 Unusable.
The average total received power observed only in OFDM symbols containing reference symbols for antenna port 0 (i.e., OFDM symbol 0 & 4 in a slot) in the measurement bandwidth over N resource blocks. The total received power of the carrier RSSI includes the power from co-channel serving & non-serving cells, adjacent channel interference, thermal noise, etc. Total measured over 12-subcarriers including RS from Serving Cell, Traffic in the Serving Cell

item_prototype.name: mdRSSI for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description:
> -65 Excellent. -64 to -75 Good. -76 to -85 Decent, may disconnect. -86 to -100 Slow with frequent disconnects.-101 to -125 Unusable.
The average total received power observed only in OFDM symbols containing reference symbols for antenna port 0 (i.e., OFDM symbol 0 & 4 in a slot) in the measurement bandwidth over N resource blocks. The total received power of the carrier RSSI includes the power from co-channel serving & non-serving cells, adjacent channel interference, thermal noise, etc. Total measured over 12-subcarriers including RS from Serving Cell, Traffic in the Serving Cell

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/mSignal[{#SNMPVALUE}])<-82
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/mSignal[{#SNMPVALUE}])>-80
trigger_prototype.name: Low Signal RSSI

trigger_prototype.expression: nodata(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/mSignal[{#SNMPVALUE}],600)=1
trigger_prototype.name: Router offline (SNMP timeout RSSI)
trigger_prototype.description: No SNMP data was collected for 600 seconds

item_prototype.name: mdSimState for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: SIM status

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/mSimState[{#SNMPVALUE}])<>"inserted"
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/mSimState[{#SNMPVALUE}])="inserted"
trigger_prototype.name: Simcard not inserted

item_prototype.name: mdSINR for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: >=20 Excellent. 20 to 13 Good. 13 to 11 Decent to slow, near 0 disconnects. <= 0 dB Unusable

item_prototype.name: mdTemperature for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Modem temperature

item_prototype.name: mdTraffic monthly for {#SNMPVALUE} operator {#OPERATOR}
item_prototype.description: Accumulated monthly mobile data usage for each operator Tested on RUT950 where wwan is always index 11 If your router has dual modems there will probably be multiple wwan interfaces so this item can be disabled.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/mTraffic[{#SNMPVALUE}-{#OPERATORNUMBER}])>{$IF.UTIL.MONTHLY}
trigger_prototype.name: High monthly traffic usage for {#SNMPVALUE} operator {#OPERATOR} (>{$IF.UTIL.MONTHLY})

Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP
Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP

trigger_prototype.expression: (last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/netInterfaceIP[{#IFINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/netInterfaceIP[{#IFINDEX}],#2))>0
trigger_prototype.name: IP Changed on Interface {#IFINDEX}

item_prototype.name: Storage {#FSNAME}: Space utilization
item_prototype.description: Space utilization in % for {#FSNAME}

item_prototype.name: Storage {#FSNAME}: Total space
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main storage allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual storage might be modified.

item_prototype.name: Storage {#FSNAME}: Used space
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}])>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and ((last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/vfs.fs.total[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}])-last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/vfs.fs.used[hrStorageUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}]))<5G or timeleft(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}],1h,100)<1d) and {#FSNAME} <> "/rom"
trigger_prototype.name: Teltonika {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 5G. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}])>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"} and ((last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/vfs.fs.total[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}])-last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/vfs.fs.used[hrStorageUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}]))<10G or timeleft(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}],1h,100)<1d) and {#FSNAME} <> "/rom"
trigger_prototype.name: Teltonika {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 10G. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

dependency.name: Teltonika {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
dependency.expression: last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}])>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and ((last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/vfs.fs.total[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}])-last(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/vfs.fs.used[hrStorageUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}]))<5G or timeleft(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}],1h,100)<1d) and {#FSNAME} <> "/rom"

item.host: Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP
Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP

item_prototype.name: {#MEMNAME}: Total memory
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main memory allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual memory might be modified.

item_prototype.name: {#MEMNAME}: Used memory
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

item_prototype.name: {#MEMNAME}: Memory utilization
item_prototype.description: Memory utilization in %

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/Template Teltonika RUT950 and RUT955 SNMP/vm.memory.util[memoryUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}
trigger_prototype.name: {#MEMNAME}: High memory utilization (>{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}% for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: The system is running out of free memory.
